captions.text:
THEME SONG: Let's go back
to that little place.

Where we used to go
in the summer days.
We dip--

Hi guys, it's Brooklyn
from "Brooklyn and Bailey."

And today I'm
going to be showing

you guys my daily makeup routine
because it was very highly
requested from all of you.

And I'm so excited
to show you this.

It's just going to be
a very natural look,

that I do for my
everyday makeup.

And I'm super excited,
so let's get started.

The first thing I do is
pull my hair out of my face.

That way I can apply my make up
without it getting in the way.

And then I actually
start on my BB cream.
I start applying this.

And I am not a fan
of heavy foundation.

I just want something
that covers the redness.

As you can see, I have redness
on my nose and my cheeks.

And this L'Oreal BB cream just
makes my face all one color,

instead of having a bunch
of red spots all over.

And Candy Johnson, actually
introduced me to this.

She told me that I should use
this, and I absolutely love it.

So I just take my BB
cream, and I'm medium,

that's my tone or color, or
whatever you like to call it.

And I like to create
dots on my face.

Like I do three dots on my
forehead, and two on my nose,

and then to on my
cheek, or my cheeks.
And then one on my chin.

I kind of look funny with all
of my BB cream dots right now,

but the next step is that I
take my Cetaphil moisturizer,

and my dermatologist
actually told me about this.

He told me that would
be a good every day
lotion or moisturizer to use.

And I just take a
little bit of this,

a little dot on my
finger, and I just

place a dot right next to
all of the BB cream dots
that I already have on my face.

And I do this just so that
when I blend them all together,

the BB cream takes on
more of a natural look.

And it goes into my face a more
natural, like a moisturizer.

And it also makes
my face smooth,
and everything looks nice.

So, then I'm going
to take my fingers

and I just rub it
all around together.
Push it all over my face.

And it doesn't need to
be perfect, quite yet.

Just apply it all
over your face.

And around your eyes, I
can just tap in a motion,

because if you smear
under your eyes,
you tend to get wrinkles faster.
And I do not want wrinkles.

So I'm just going to
tap under my eyes.

And then just keep rubbing
in your circular motions,
or tapping motions, all over.

And rub, I like to
rub over the redness,

and make sure that
you get everywhere
that you need it to go.

And up on you're
on your forehead,

I like to push mine
up into my hairline,

so that the color
continues to spread,

and it doesn't look like there's
a big line around my face.

And I do that
around my ears too.

I push it onto these, and up
on my ears and everything.

So it all is one
color and it doesn't

look like I just have
my foundation line.

OK now that kind of
applied, I'm going
to take my beauty blender.

It's this little
raindrop looking thing.

And I'm going to just push it
so that my foundation is more

smoothed out, and it
doesn't look cakey.

And again, you want
to tap under the eyes,

so that you don't
get those wrinkles.

Some people like to talk
all over their face,
but I prefer to rub mine.
But tapping works the same.
It's just a different method.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
Next I apply concealer.

And I use L'Oreal color
crayon, this little thing.

This color crayon
concealer stick.

And I am the fair
light W123 color,

but there's like seven or
eight different sticks.

So you can find whatever color,
or shade, you are to use.

And I prefer mine
to be a bit lighter,

because even though it's
a concealer, and use
like in a highlighter way.

So on my red spots,
and my T zone.

So I apply some right here on
my nose, just a little bit.
And down my nose.

And then right here around--
that looks kind of funny,
around my nostrils.

And then a little
bit on my chin.

And then under the
eyes if I need it.

And then to blend
it all in, I'm going
to use my beauty blender again.

But this time, I'm
going to tap because you
don't want to rub this one.
That's no good.

You want to tap it
so it's in place.

And it highlights
like you want it to.

And this just makes the
redness, or darkness,
where you apply it go away.

THEME SONG- go back
to that little place.
Where we used to go--

Now that we have made
our face all one color,

and it's all uniform, I kind
of feel zombieish almost,
because I have no color.

So this is when
I apply my blush.

And I have Bare
Minerals', French Kiss.
Is that upside down?

OK, Bare Minerals'
French Kiss color.

And I'm just going to
take my blush brush, which

is the Sigma, let me look,
Sigma Duo Fiber, F50.

And I just apply, rub it
on the brush, like so.

And then I tap some
of it off, in case

I get a ton of blush
on there because I

don't want a big
red spot on my face.

And then I always do it two
fingers away from my nose,

just because that way it looks
more natural, and not like it's
all powered on.
Two fingers away from my nose.

And then I smile,
and then I just

start rubbing in a circular
motion, all the way my cheek.

And I do it towards
my temple, that way

it looks like I'm blushing, not
like it was just red-- you know

in the movies when they have
the red circles, and then

the freckles, and the
dots, the little dolls.

No, you don't want
to look like that.

So I'm going to circular
motion up my face, like so.
And then on the other side.

Two fingers away from my nose,
and then circular motion,
all the way up.

Next I apply my overall powder,
to make my face less shiny.

And I use Makeup Forever
powder, like the HD powder.

And I just take my Sigma brush,
and it's a large powder F30
brush.

And I take my powder,
and I brush it on.

And you can see, there's kind
of a lot that comes on it,

so you want to tap
it a few times.

Or I like to tap the brush,
that way it powders off,
so I don't get a ton on my face.

And then I just apply
it all over my face.
Woo!
That way, it doesn't look shiny.

And kind of finishes
that make up.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

Next I use my spoolie, which
is this little swirly brush.

And I use it to
shape my eyebrows.

And at this age,
I don't actually
fill in my eyebrows or anything.
I just leave them natural.
But I do use this to shape it.

And I just take it, and
I brush it up and away
from my eyes and my eyelids.

That way, it will
open up my eyes more.

And I just brought it up,
and I just kind of shape it.

And there's no way
or method to do this.

You just brush it,
comb it through.

And then brush it up
and smooth it out.

And then I'm just going to
switch to this other eyebrow.

Up and away from my eyelids,
so it will open up my eyes.

and then you're done
with your spoolie.
Next I apply eye shadow.

I'm going to be
using the Physician's
Formula natural nude palette.

And it's just this
little palette,

and it's got the same natural
colors-- oh you can't see it.

It's got the same
natural colors in it,

that the naked palette has,
but it's a lot less expensive,

and smaller, for those of us who
don't use a ton of eyeshadow.

And I'm going to be
using in this eye shading
E55 brush from Sigma.

And I take my white
eye shadow, and I just
brush it onto the brush.

And then I put it underneath
this little arch in my eyebrow.

And this is supposed
to help open your eye.

I think I actually learned
this from a magazine.

But I've been doing
it for a while now,
and I really like it.

So I'm just going
to apply there.

And then I also apply, in
the corners of my eyes,

and occasionally I apply it
in the inside lid of my eye.

But I'm not going
to do that today.

I'm just going to
apply right here.

And apply on the corners
of my eyes, in here,

and it makes it a little
white, and shiny, and sparkly.

And then if you
want, you can also

apply it, just like a thin
coat, on your eyelids as well.

Just to blend that
all in, so it doesn't

look like there are
random white spots.

And that is all I
have for eye shadow.

Next I'm going to
curl my eyelashes.

I actually have a mascara
applying basic video, which

I will put the link to below,
if you want to check that out

for all the details on
how I curl my eyelashes,
and apply my mascara.

But for now, the only
difference in today's routine

for my mascara, is that instead
of using the Green Physician's

Formula mascara, I'm
using the pink one.

And there's not
really a difference,

except for the color of
the bottle that I can tell.

So that is the only
difference in what
I'm going to be doing today.

But first you're going to
want to curl your eyelashes.

And I'm just going to
curl them up like this.
And back down.
And the other eye.

For my first layer of mascara,
I use of Almay One Coat
Thickening.

And it is this dark
kind of mascara.

And I just apply a
little bit of it.
I like to blink on mine.

I think that helps
apply it better.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

And then I'm going to take
my pink Physician's Formula
Mascara, for my second coat.
And apply that as well.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

And then if you have any
excess mascara that's

gone on your eyelids,
or under your eyes,

I usually take my makeup
remover and my little--
what is this called?

Small angle E65
brush, and I just

dip it in my makeup
remover, and wipe off
all of that excess mascara.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

And last, but not least,
for my finishing touch,

I'm going to be applying some
Bath and Body Works Frozen
Daiquiri lip gloss.

And it's just like a
light sparkly pink,

and it's kind of
just a neutral color,
so it will go with anything.
And apply that.
And we are done.

Oh and I need to take
my out, of course,
because that's not finished.
Now, we are done.

Thank you guys so much
for watching this video.

I hope you enjoyed my
everyday makeup routine.

And be sure to check out
us at Instagram at Brooklyn

and Bailey, or Twitter
at Brook and Bailey.

And we'll see you
guys next week.
Bye.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
-Is anyone wearing pink?
I'm not wearing pink.
-I am.
-You're wearing pink?
Where?
Oh you're lips are pink.
Good one.
They are pink.

I don't use a ton,
just enough to-- Whoop!
Cover it.
OK.
There goes the lid.
Well, I'll get that later.
I look so funny when I do that.
OK.
And then, op.
Where'd my mascara go?
Did it fall?
[FAN SOUND]
What the?
